parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.
Adulation, praise, blessing, gift.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.
From koinonos; partnership, i.e. participation, or intercourse, or benefaction.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To break (in pieces), break bread. A primary verb; to break.
From koinonos; partnership, i.e. participation, or intercourse, or benefaction.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
